___PayloadCertificateUUID.description: UUID of the payload containing the asymmetric recovery key certificate payload.

___DeferForceAtUserLoginMaxBypassAttempt.description: When using the Defer option you can optionally set this key to the maximum number of times the user can bypass enabling FileVault before it will require that it be enabled before the user can log in. If set to 0, it will always prompt to enable FileVault until it is enabled, though it will allow you to bypass enabling it. Setting this key to –1 will disable this feature.

___PayloadIdentifier.description: A unique identifier for the payload, dot-delimited.  Usually root PayloadIdentifier+subidentifier

___OutputPath.description: Path to the location where the recovery key and computer information plist will be stored.

___PayloadVersion.description: The version of the whole configuration profile.

___Password.description: User password of the Open Directory user that will be added to FileVault. Use the UserEntersMissingInfo key if you want to prompt for this information.

___ShowRecoveryKey.description: Set to false to not display the personal recovery key to the user after FileVault is enabled

___PayloadType.description: The type of the payload, a reverse dns string

___PayloadOrganization.description: This value describes the issuing organization of the profile, as displayed to the user

___UseKeychain.description: If set to true and no certificate information is provided in this payload, the keychain already created at /Library/Keychains/FileVaultMaster.keychain will be used when the institutional recovery key is added.

___Certificate.description: DER-encoded certificate data if an institutional recovery key will be added.

___Defer.description: Set to true to defer enabling FileVault until the designated user logs out. For details, see fdesetup(8). The person enabling FileVault must be either a local user or a mobile account user.

___UseRecoveryKey.description: Set to true to create a personal recovery key

___Enable.description: Set to 'On' to enable FileVault. Set to 'Off' to disable FileVault. This value is required.

___Username.description: User name of the Open Directory user that will be added to FileVault.

___DeferDontAskAtUserLogout.description: When using the Defer option, set this key to true to not request enabling FileVault at user logout time.

___UserEntersMissingInfo.description: Set to true for manual profile installs to prompt for missing user name or password fields.
